info.name: Webex Teams API
info.description:
Hey there! Thanks for checking out Cisco Webex for Developers. If you've used Cisco Webex Meetings or Cisco Webex Teams (formerly Cisco Spark) you know how easy it is to meet and collaborate with your team members and customers.

To use this collection you'll need to create and activate a Postman Environment, that contains an environment variable called "access_token" which is set to a valid Webex access token.  The easiest way to get one of these is to copy your personal access token from [Webex For Developers](https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/getting-started#accounts-and-authentication).   This token is good for 12 hours.

The Webex for Developers program opens up the power behind the Webex platform to anyone seeking to extend the Webex experience.

Webex Meetings is a powerful conferencing solution that lets you connect with anyone, anywhere, in real time. By combining video, audio and content sharing, Webex Meetings creates an effective conferencing environment, leading to more productive meetings and increased productivity. Developer information for Webex Meetings will soon be available on this site. In the meantime, to get started with developing for Webex Meetings, please see the Getting Started guides over on Cisco DevNet. Keep reading for information about Webex Teams.

Webex Teams makes staying in sync with your teammates and customers easy.
Conversations in Webex Teams take place in virtual meeting rooms. Some rooms live for a few hours while others become permanent fixtures of your team's workflow with titles like Daily Standup or Build Status. Webex Teams allows conversations to flow seamlessly between messages, video calls, and real-time whiteboarding sessions. No other solution brings together so many facets of collaboration into a single unified platform.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/getting-started

item.name: Memberships

request.description:
Lists all room memberships. By default, lists memberships for rooms to which the authenticated user belongs.

Use query parameters to filter the response.

Use roomId to list memberships for a room, by ID.

Use either personId or personEmail to filter the results.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/memberships/list-memberships

item.name: Create a room (for test run purpose)

exec: tests["Create a room: cannot retreive room identifier"] = false
tests["Create a room: created with id:" + roomID] = true

request.description:
Creates a room. The authenticated user is automatically added as a member of the room. See the Memberships API to learn how to add more people to the room.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/create-a-room

Lists all room memberships. By default, lists memberships for rooms to which the authenticated user belongs.

Use query parameters to filter the response.

Use roomId to list memberships for a room, by ID.

Use either personId or personEmail to filter the results.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/memberships/list-memberships

exec: tests["Create a membership: cannot retreive identifier"] = false
tests["Create a membership: created with id:" + membershipID] = true

request.description:
Add someone to a room by Person ID or email address; optionally making them a moderator.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/memberships/create-a-membership

exec: tests["Get membership details: cannot retreive identifier"] = false;
tests["Get membership details: wrong id:" + membershipID] = false;
tests["Get membership details: correct id:" + membershipID] = true;

request.description:
Get details for a membership by ID.

Specify the membership ID in the membershipId URI parameter.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/memberships/get-membership-details

Updates properties for a membership by ID.

Specify the membership ID in the membershipId URI parameter.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-memberships-membershipId-put.html

Deletes a membership by ID.

Specify the membership ID in the membershipId URI parameter.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/memberships/delete-a-membership

Deletes a room, by ID.

Specify the room ID in the roomId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/delete-a-room

item.description:
Memberships represent a person's relationship to a room. Use this API to list members of any room that you're in or create memberships to invite someone to a room. Memberships can also be updated to make someone a moderator or deleted to remove them from the room.

Just like in the Webex Teams app, you must be a member of the room in order to list its memberships or invite people.

https://developer.webex.com/resource-memberships.html

item.name: Messages
Create a room (for test run purpose)

exec: tests["Create a room: cannot retreive identifier"] = false
tests["Create a room: created with id:" + roomID] = true

request.description:
Creates a room. The authenticated user is automatically added as a member of the room. See the Memberships API to learn how to add more people to the room.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/memberships/create-a-membership

Lists all messages in a room. If present, includes the associated media content attachment for each message.

The list sorts the messages in descending order by creation date.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/messages/list-messages

exec: tests["Create a message: cannot retreive identifier"] = false
tests["Create a message: created with id:" + messageID] = true

request.description:
Posts a plain text or markdown message, and optionally, a media content attachment, to a room.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/messages/create-a-message

exec: tests["Get message details: cannot retreive identifier"] = false;
tests["Get message details: wrong id:" + messageID] = false;
tests["Get message details: correct id:" + messageID] = true;
// Save the entire response for subsequent edit operations

request.description:
Shows details for a message, by message ID.

Specify the message ID in the messageId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/messages/get-message-details

exec: tests["Get message details: cannot retreive identifier"] = false;
tests["Get message details: wrong id:" + messageID] = false;
tests["Get message details: correct id:" + messageID] = true;
// Get the response body from the previous GET
// This is the modification we want to do
theMessage.text = "This is an edited message text";
// If the previous message was in markdown it will have an html attribute
// The API does not allow both the markdown and html attributs to be set so the html must be deleted before submitting
// It is OK, but not necessary to send the other message DTO attributes
// The API ignores them if they are set, but may generate errors if they are changed
// Write the updated body for the PUT back to the environment

request.description:
Shows details for a message, by message ID.

Specify the message ID in the messageId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/messages/edit-a-message

tests["Create a message: created with id:" + messageID] = true

body.raw:
{
  "roomId" : "{{_room}}",
  "markdown" : "# Message Formatting!
Webex Teams clients now render rich text; enabling bots and integrations to communicate business data in a way that's fun to read and easy on the eyes!

## Styling Text
Messages are styled using [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax) syntax allowing text to be emphasized in **bold**, *italics* on `in-line code`.

### Fenced Code Blocks
Webex can now also render fenced code blocks using triple backticks (aka GitHub Flavored Markdown)

```
source 'https://github.com/CocoaPods/Specs.git'
platform :ios, '8.0'
use_frameworks!

post_install do |installer|
  installer.pods_project.targets.each do |target|
    target.build_configurations.each do |config|
      config.build_settings['ENABLE_BITCODE'] = 'NO'
    end
  end
end

target 'TeamsBnB' do
  pod 'TeamsSDK', :path => '../'
  pod 'Toast-Swift', '~> 1.1.0'
end
```

### Lists

Lists are a great way to organize information or present options to your audience.

###Ordered Lists
1. List Item
2. List Item
3. List Item

###Unordered Lists
* List Item
* List Item
* List Item
     * Sub Item
         * SubSub Item

### Block Quotes

> Quoting is a super powerful way for bots to respond to a message that happened a while back in the conversation.

",
  "text": "This text would be displayed by Webex Teams clients that do not support markdown."
}

To get more info about message formatting, check https://developer.webex.com/formatting-messages.html

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/messages/create-a-message

{ "roomId" : "{{_room}}", "html" : "

Well as you know, HTML is not officially supported! Let's try it though ;-)

Message Formatting!

Webex Teams clients now render rich text; enabling bots and integrations to communicate business data in a way that's fun to read and easy on the eyes!

Styling Text

Messages are styled using Markdown syntax allowing text to be emphasized in bold, italics on in-line code.

Fenced Code Blocks

Webex Teams clients can now also render fenced code blocks using triple backticks (aka GitHub Flavored Markdown)

source 'https://github.com/CocoaPods/Specs.git'
platform :ios, '8.0'
use_frameworks!

post_install do |installer|
  installer.pods_project.targets.each do |target|
    target.build_configurations.each do |config|
      config.build_settings['ENABLE_BITCODE'] = 'NO'
    end
  end
end

target 'TeamsBnB' do
  pod 'TeamsSDK', :path => '../'
  pod 'Toast-Swift', '~> 1.1.0'
end

Lists

Lists are a great way to organize information or present options to your audience.

Orderd Lists

  1. List Item
  2. List Item
  3. List Item

Unordered Lists

  • List Item
  • List Item
  • List Item

Block Quotes

Quoting is a super powerful way for bots to respond to a message that happened a while back in the conversation.

Horizontal Lines

well, as others, it's not officially supported, but pretty handy ;-)

request.description:
Posts a plain text or markdown message, and optionally, a media content attachment, to a room.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/messages/create-a-message

Deletes a message, by message ID.

Specify the message ID in the messageId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/messages/delete-a-message

Deletes a room, by ID.

Specify the room ID in the roomId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/delete-a-room

item.description:
Messages are how we communicate in a room. In Webex Teams, each message is displayed on its own line along with a timestamp and sender information. Use this API to list, create, and delete messages.

Message can contain plain text, rich text, and a file attachment.

Just like in the Webex Teams app, you must be a member of the room in order to target it with this API.

https://developer.webex.com/resource-messages.html

item.name: People

request.description:
List people in your organization.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/people/list-people

exec: tests["List people: cannot retreive result"] = false
tests["List people: retreived with id:" + personID] = true

request.description:
List people in your organization.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/people/list-people

exec: tests["Get person details: cannot retreive person identifier"] = false;
tests["Get person details: wrong id:" + personID] = false;
tests["Get person details: correct id:" + personID] = true;

request.description:
Shows details for a person, by ID.

Specify the person ID in the personId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/people/get-person-details

Show the profile for the authenticated user.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/people/get-my-own-details

item.description:
People are registered users of Webex Teams. Searching and viewing People requires an auth token with a scope of spark:people_read. Viewing the list of all People in your Organization requires an administrator auth token with spark-admin:people_read scope. Adding, updating, and removing People requires an administrator auth token with the spark-admin:people_write scope.

To learn more about managing people in a room see the Memberships API. For information about how to allocate Hybrid Services licenses to people, see the Managing Hybrid Services guide.

https://developer.webex.com/resource-people.html

item.name: Rooms

request.description:
List rooms.

By default, lists rooms to which the authenticated user belongs.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/list-rooms

List rooms.

By default, lists rooms to which the authenticated user belongs.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/list-rooms

exec: tests["Create a room: cannot retreive room identifier"] = false
tests["Create a room: created with id:" + roomID] = true

request.description:
Creates a room. The authenticated user is automatically added as a member of the room. See the Memberships API to learn how to add more people to the room.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/create-a-room

Specify the room ID in the roomId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/get-room-details

Updates details for a room, by ID.

Specify the room ID in the roomId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/update-a-room

Deletes a room, by ID.

Specify the room ID in the roomId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/delete-a-room

item.description:
Rooms are virtual meeting places where people post messages and collaborate to get work done. This API is used to manage the rooms themselves. Rooms are created and deleted with this API. You can also update a room to change its title, for example.

To create a team room, specify the a teamId in POST payload. Note that once a room is added to a team, it cannot be moved. To learn more about managing teams, see the Teams API.

To manage people in a room see the Memberships API.

To post content see the Messages API.

https://developer.webex.com/resource-rooms.html

exec: tests["Create a team: cannot retreive team identifier"] = false
tests["Create a team: created with id:" + teamID] = true

request.description:

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/teams/create-a-team

Lists all team memberships. By default, lists memberships for teams to which the authenticated user belongs.

Use query parameters to filter the response.

Use teamId to list memberships for a team, by ID.

Use either personId or personEmail to filter the results.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/team-memberships/list-team-memberships

tests["Get membership details: wrong id:" + membershipID] = false;
tests["Get membership details: correct id:" + membershipID] = true;

request.description:

Specify the membership ID in the membershipId URI parameter.

Specify the membership ID in the membershipId URI parameter.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/team-memberships/update-a-team-membership

Specify the membership ID in the membershipId URI parameter.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/team-memberships/delete-a-team-membership

Delete a team.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/teams/delete-a-team

item.description:
Team Memberships represent a person's relationship to a team. Use this API to list members of any team that you're in or create memberships to invite someone to a team. Team memberships can also be updated to make someone a moderator or deleted to remove them from the team.

Just like in the Webex Teams app, you must be a member of the team in order to list its memberships or invite people..

https://developer.webex.com/resource-team-memberships.html

item.description:
Teams are groups of people with a set of rooms that are visible to all members of that team. This API is used to manage the teams themselves. Teams are created and deleted with this API. You can also update a team to change its name, for example.

To manage people in a team see the Team Memberships API.

To manage team rooms see the Rooms API.

https://developer.webex.com/resource-teams.html

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/webhooks/list-webhooks

item.name: Add a message (for test run purpose)

request.description: adds a message in a room, to check an event is triggered
check an event has been posted

Deletes a webhook, by ID.

Specify the webhook ID in the webhookId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/webhooks/delete-a-webhook

Deletes a room, by ID.

Specify the room ID in the roomId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/rooms/delete-a-room

item.description:
Webhooks allow your app to be notified via HTTP when a specific event occurs in Webex Teams. For example, your app can register a webhook to be notified when a new message is posted into a specific room.

Events trigger in near real-time allowing your app and backend IT systems to stay in sync with new content and room activity.

Check the Webhooks Guide and our blog regularly for announcements of additional webhook resources and event types.

https://developer.webex.com/resource-webhooks.html
